title: CNBC Daily Open: U.S. stocks don't seem concerned about inflation, disregard jumping retail sales
description: January's retail sales, like the months' jobs report and consumer price index, were higher than expected. But stocks don't seem concerned anymore.

title: Cisco shares jump after networking company beats estimates, boosts full-year guidance
description: Cisco said it's seeing more recurring revenue, while efforts to improve the company's component supply availability are also paying off.

title: FDA advisors recommend over-the-counter use of life-saving opioid overdose treatment Narcan
description: If the life-saving nasal spray Narcan is approved for over-the-counter use, people could buy it in supermarkets, convenience stores or even vending machines.

title: Charlie Munger says BYD is so far ahead of Tesla in China it's almost ridiculous
description: Charlie Munger said Wednesday that Tesla pales in comparison to BYD in China, calling the Chinese electric vehicle maker his favorite stock ever.

title: McDonald's to launch McPlant nuggets made with Beyond Meat in Germany
description: McDonald's customers in Germany will be able to order plant-based McPlant nuggets starting Feb. 22.

title: Google CEO tells employees some of company's top products 'were not first to market' as A.I. pressure mounts
description: Google leadership has faced criticism of late for its slow response to ChatGPT and emerging competition from Microsoft.

title: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried's two bond guarantors unsealed, both with ties to Stanford
description: The names of FTX co-founder Sam Bankman Fried's bond guarantors were unsealed on Wednesday after a judge granted a motion to have their identities made public.

title: Amazon cuts ties with EU distributors amid wider push to trim costs
description: Amazon said the change will help it "control our costs and keep prices low for customers."

title: DOJ reportedly accelerates Apple antitrust investigation
description: The companies' policies for third-party apps on its devices and whether it unfairly favors its own products are two areas of focus, according to the Journal.

title: 'Ant-Man and the Wasp in Quantumania' reviews: The villain is good, but the movie is bad
description: Critics praise Jonathan Majors' role of Kang in Marvel's "Ant-Man and the Wasp in Quantumania," but the film is a "chaotic, woefully unfunny mess."

title: Rep. Matt Gaetz won't be criminally charged in DOJ sex trafficking probe, his lawyers say
description: The Department of Justice decision not to prosecute Rep. Matt Gaetz came months after a former friend was sentenced for sex trafficking and other crimes.

title: Only 9% of Americans think A.I. development will do more good than harm
description: Artificial intelligence tools that can spit out responses that read like they were written by a human have become the hottest part of the technology industry.

title: Founder who sold his startup to Google says the company has lost its mission, is mismanaged and has no sense of urgency
description: A former Google employee said the technology giant is inefficient, plagued by mismanagement and paralyzed by risk.

title: Watch Charlie Munger speak at the Daily Journal annual meeting
description: Charlie Munger, a shareholder and board member for the Daily Journal, will speak at the organization's annual meeting on Wednesday.

title: World's oldest Hebrew Bible could fetch $50 million at auction
description: The Codex Sassoon, a Hebrew Bible more than 1,000 years old, could end up the most valuable historical document ever auctioned.

title: Watch live: Nikki Haley kicks off 2024 presidential campaign in South Carolina
description: Haley's White House bid makes her the first major challenger to former President Donald Trump, who has technically been on the campaign trail for months.

title: Elon Musk, who co-founded firm behind ChatGPT, warns A.I. is 'one of the biggest risks' to civilization
description: ChatGPT "has illustrated to people just how advanced AI has become," according to Musk.

title: SEC Chair Gensler proposes rules that would change which crypto firms can custody customer assets
description: SEC chair Gary Gensler proposed sweeping reforms that would alter the nature of crypto exchanges' institutional and investor custody programs.

title: Early Deliveroo investor Hoxton Ventures is set to lose one of its founding partners
description: European venture capital firm Hoxton Ventures, a backer of some of the U.K.'s best-known tech unicorns, is set to lose one of its founding partners.

title: Apple patent adds to hype around foldable device from the iPhone maker
description: Apple is yet to introduce a foldable iPhone or any device, unlike competitors such as Samsung.

title: Nicola Sturgeon announces shock resignation as Scottish first minister
description: Nicola Sturgeon has announced her shock resignation as Scottish first minister, saying her departure is not the result of short-term pressures.

title: Singapore must prepare for economic and geopolitical headwinds, says Lawrence Wong
description: Escalating conflict in the Russia-Ukraine war and the slowing global economy are downside risks that Singapore must be prepared for, says Lawrence Wong.

title: ASML says ex-China employee misappropriated data relating to its critical chip technology
description: The security incident comes at a sensitive time for ASML which has been caught in the middle of the battle for tech supremacy between the U.S. and China

title: Elon Musk aiming to appoint his successor as Twitter CEO by the end of 2023
description: Elon Musk said Wednesday that he might be able to appoint his successor as Twitter CEO by the end of 2023.

title: Barclays posts 19% slide in annual net profit after costly U.S. trading blunder; Shares down 8%
description: Barclays on Wednesday reported a full-year net profit of £5 billion ($6.05 billion) for 2022, beating consensus expectations of £4.95 billion.

title: BlackRock downgrades Japan stocks on possible monetary policy shift
description: BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, cut Japanese stocks to "underweight" – as Japan is set to appoint a new governor to lead its central bank.

title: Russia's budget deficit has surged. But economists say Moscow won't drain its war chest any time soon
description: Russia's budget deficit hit a record 1.8 trillion rubles ($24.4 million) in January, with spending growing by 58% from the previous year while revenues fell by more than a third.

title: Indian tycoon Gautam Adani dismisses market volatility as 'temporary'
description: Indian billionaire Gautam Adani downplayed the recent market volatility "as temporary" following a scathing report from a U.S. short-seller firm.

title: UK inflation rate dips for third straight month to hit 10.1%
description: UK inflation dropped for the third month in a row but energy and food prices continue to put pressure on British households.

title: CNBC Daily Open: U.S. stocks shrug off hot inflation numbers
description: A hotter-than-expected CPI reading for January caused U.S. Treasury yields to increase. But stocks were remarkably resilient.

title: India stock markets have been volatile. Analysts say these sectors are worth watching
description: India is set to pump up its capital expenditure in hopes to grow its economy, and analysts are suggesting now's the time to invest in these sectors.

title: Singapore faces a 'delicate balancing act' amid weak economy and inflation, says deputy PM
description: Singapore's DPM Lawrence Wong says Budget 2023 was "particularly challenging" as the country tried to ensure fiscal prudence while helping Singaporeans with cost of living.

title: Chinese EV startup Jidu plans to use ChatGPT-like tech
description: The combined tech aims to improve users' interactivity with the car, the startup said. So-called smart cars typically include voice control.

title: Seen Big Ben already? Here's a Londoner's guide to visiting other parts of the city
description: How a born-and-raised Londoner explores the city's parks, restaurants and buildings.

title: China's economic recovery is off to a slow start
description: Preliminary economic data indicate overall growth isn't yet roaring back since mainland China ended its Covid controls in early December.

title: Microsoft's Bing A.I. made several factual errors in last week's launch demo
description: In showing off its chatbot technology last week, Microsoft's AI analyzed earnings reports and produced some incorrect numbers for Gap and Lululemon.
